definition: to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to crop up/to pop up/to emerge abruptly
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
disco dancing/to dance at a disco

sentences.english: Eleanor jumps up and down, eager to show off her skills.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉諾跳上蹦下，急着要炫耀她的本領。

sentences.english: My legs were tired with jumping and my face burned.
sentences.chinese: 我的雙腿蹦得累極了，臉也凍得火辣辣的。

sentences.english: The cork popped out and the champagnegushed from the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 軟木塞啪地一聲蹦了出來，香檳就從瓶口噴出來了。

sentences.english: I walk through the park on a sunny summer's day.
sentences.chinese: 我正正在一個陽勒奼蹦夜走過了母園。

sentences.english: They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.
sentences.chinese: 他們蹦上城，躥上牆，爬上房屋，進入窗戶如同盜賊。

sentences.english: Touching something soft, I sprang quickly back.
sentences.chinese: 摸到一種軟呼呼的東西，我一下子蹦了回來。

sentences.english: While pumping the gas, we clapped our hands and jumped around to stay warm.
sentences.chinese: 加油時，我們一邊搓手一邊蹦來跳去地取暖。

sentences.english: He jigged up and down with excitement.
The Rat danced up and down in the road, simply transported with passion.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠怒火萬丈，在路上又蹦又跳。

sentences.english: She skipped up flights of stairs to the tower.
sentences.chinese: 她一蹦一跳地踏着階梯往塔上走去。

sentences.english: Algae can make the leap from start to finish directly, whereas vascular plants cannot.
sentences.chinese: 海藻可以直接從開始蹦到結束，而導管植物不可以。

sentences.english: But I would say 10 years is the number that pops into my mind.
sentences.chinese: 但是10這個數字恰好從我腦子裏蹦了出來。

sentences.english: Little children were popping in and out.
She was chomping away on a bagel.
sentences.chinese: 她在嘎蹦嘎嘣地啃着一個硬麪包圈。

sentences.english: Lumme , I want to the Men's room after a jump just now.
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，剛剛一蹦，我想去上廁所了。

sentences.english: As the sport of canyoning grows, so too does our commitment to it.
sentences.chinese: 蹦繩運動的發展，對我們產品的質量要求也越來越高。

definition: to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
to stumble/to slip/variant of 達|达[da2]
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
